page.title: 18Ferreting in Oakley
page.content: Ferreting is a sport that involves putting the ferret down the rabbit warren. Purse nets are placed over the holes. The ferret chases the rabbits and they run out of the hole and into the nets. There are two main breeds of ferret, the albino and the polecat. The polecat has bits of brown on it. The equipment for ferreting is:- Purse nets which are nets about 3 feet long and which close when a rabbit goes in. Ferret finder - an electronic buzzer which picks up a signal from the collar on the ferret. Bill hook - an implement for cutting into hedges. Carrying box - a well ventilated wooden box in which to take a ferret to work. Spade - to dig out ferrets that have caught rabbits underground or 'laid up'.
